alert.note: Alert for Christian (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Christian County through 415 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hopkinsville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Christian County. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 79 and 83. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
